intro: Ricinocarpus alopecuroidea, commonly known as the sea holly, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its distinctive blue or purple flowers and succulent, fleshy leaves adapted to tolerate saline and arid conditions. The plant belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is known for its ability to thrive in sandy soils. Its unique morphology includes a sprawling growth habit with hairy stems and small, clustered flowers. Ricinocarpus alopecuroidea plays an important ecological role in stabilizing coastal dunes and providing habitat for various small organisms.
